  "Allegations" : "[CUSTOMER] REQUESTED AN UNSOLICITED PURCHASE OF 100,000 ISON ON 10/11/05. RR UNDERSTOOD ORDER WAS FOR 100,000 SHARES, UPON EXECUTION SHE CALLED THE CLIENT TO CONFIRM THE TRADE AND INFORMED HIM THE DOLLAR AMOUNT DUE WAS $221,460. CLIENT INDICATED THAT HE HAD INTENDED TO PURCHASE $100,000 OF ISON, NOT 100,000 SHARES, BUT LET THE TRADE STAND; HE THEN SENT IN A CHECK PAYING THE ENTIRE $221,460. RR CONTACTED CLIENT ON 6/9/06 REGARDING THE UNREALIZED LOSS IN THE SECURITY; AT THAT TIME THE CLIENT INDICATED HE DID NOT WISH TO SELL AND THAT HE HAD CONTACTED THE PRESIDENT OF ISON. THERE WAS NO FURTHER COMMUNICATION FROM CLIENT UNTIL EARLY DEC 07. AT THAT TIME A LETTER WAS RECEIVED THAT DID NOT SPECIFY HIS WISHES BUT SUGGESTED THAT THE MANAGEMENT OF DAVENPORT SHOULD LOOK INTO THE SITUATION. CLIENT WAS UNAVAILABLE TO MEET WITH MANAGEMENT UNTIL 4/01/08 AT WHICH TIME HE QUANTIFIED HIS CONCERN.",
